stories.title: Not important enough: 1Password abandons its native Mac app

stories.text:
So I finally agreed to alexa's prompts to concede to an extra 3$ a month for unlimited music. I Immediately asked to cancel, but was instructed to get on the app I dont have due to only owning legacy incompatible hardware, to cancel.

Should I just pay and enjoy the bonus music and be thankfull?!?....$h0uld I take the vaccine and appreciate my betters? M@$kWH0L3s need not reply.

SP
stories.title: Ask HN: So I finally aquiesed to Alexa?

stories.text:
Now that various jurisdictions around the world have their own versions of covid passes, is there a platform that can verify more than one of them?

The types I’m currently aware of that have significant adoption are:

EU Covid pass (digital green certificate) NHS (UK) vaccination certificate SMART health cards (US various) Excelsior pass (NY)

There are probably others.

Most seem to be QR codes with signatures over various claims. I don’t see why a single app couldn’t verify all of them if the public key registries are public.

If such a platform doesn’t yet exist, is anyone working on one? It sounds like the Linux Foundation Public Health people are investigating things from a policy perspective.
stories.title: Ask HN: Interoperable Covid Pass Verifier
